messages: 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:25): (bjoern, if you read these logs at all the answer to your question is "no")

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:34): wonders why a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d is so hung up on aria when there is agreement that aria will be included in html5 just as soon as the interaction with other parts of html5 is defined
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:34): and ARIA itself is defined in implementable terms
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:35): And when several "whatwg" people spent a great deal of effort making it possible to implement aria
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:36): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: That's roughly the same thing. But there is an aria taskforce thing
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:36): yeah dunno, maybe because the TAG used it as example
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:36): and he's obviously been reading up on what happened so it might just have come from that debate

2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:37): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, I'm not really sure it's the same; defining how ARIA interacts with HTML and how ARIA maps to platform accessibility APIs seems quite separate

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:38): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: Well it's kind of a subset I guess. Define how aria maps to accessibility apis, define how html maps to accessibility apis and define precedence and you can infer how aria fits into html
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:40): Who is doing the aria work?
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:41): not sure
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:41): hasn't been following it
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:50): maybe now aaronlev left IBM it's sort of falling through the cracks?
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (10:50): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: hahaha
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (10:50): is supportive
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (10:51): definitely not falling through the cracks
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:51): well, I meant the ARIA mapping to platform APIs
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:51): a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d: regarding your document, I think there are pretty clear plans to integrate api in html5
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:51): though someone from Microsoft was leading that too, I recall now
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:52): But it is blocking on aria being defined in a sutiable way
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (10:52): aria is an exemplar, those that worked on it have worked well with those that are leading html5
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (10:52): other groups (e.g. RDFa): not so much
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:53): ARIA was quite a tough sell actually
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:54): ask hsivonen
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (10:54): I watched it from the sidelines
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:54): they seemed to care more about XHTML2 than HTML at various points in the discussion o_O
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:55): a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d: There are still some technical issues blocking aria. Like, say, how does aria-labelledby interact with @headers on a <td>
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:55): I believe integrating aria into HTML5 is blocking on those issues being reslved
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (10:55): ARIA is in last call... perhaps somebody should raise such issues?
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:56): the PFWG wants to address those in separate documents
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:56): including e.g. basic things such as how to implement it
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:56): Although I find the tangle of accessibility related lists hard to follow
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (10:57): My read is that those that want ARIA want it in HTML5, and view being in a separate document as somewhat suboptimal
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:57): who are "those that want aria" in this case?
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (10:58): Mostly I talk to RichardS, mainly because he's in my dept.

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:59): I think it is possible to have HTML5 define how ARIA+HTML5 works. Although I think it is a little dependant on the outcome of this aria taskforce thing what it should say
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:00): (the one about how to map aria to accessibility apis)
